title: Prohibits the operation of a motor vehicle on a public road, street or highway which is equipped with a display device within the view of the operator
summary: Prohibits the operation of a motor vehicle on a public road, street or highway which is equipped with a display device within the view of the operator; defines the term "display device" as equipment designed and used for the purpose of receiving and displaying a broadcast image.

       AN  ACT  to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to the opera-
         tion of motor vehicles with a display device

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Subdivision  24 of section 375 of the vehicle and traffic
    2  law, as amended by chapter 39 of the laws of 1989, is amended to read as
    3  follows:
    4    24. (A) It shall be unlawful to operate upon  any  public  highway  in
    5  this  state a motor vehicle which is equipped with a [television receiv-
    6  ing set] DISPLAY DEVICE within view of the operator or in which a [tele-
    7  vision receiving set] DISPLAY DEVICE is in operation within the view  of
    8  the  operator. A motor vehicle shall not be deemed to be equipped with a
    9  [television receiving set] DISPLAY DEVICE (I) solely because such  [set]
   10  DISPLAY  DEVICE utilizes power from such vehicle OR (II) IF SUCH DISPLAY
   11  DEVICE IS EQUIPPED WITH A FUNCTIONING DEVICE THAT DISABLES  SUCH  EQUIP-
   12  MENT  WHENEVER  SUCH  MOTOR VEHICLE IS IN MOTION. The provisions of this
   13  subdivision shall not prohibit a vehicle with a weight of  ten  thousand
   14  pounds  or  more  or  a  school bus from using closed-circuit television
   15  receiving equipment exclusively for safety and maneuvering purposes,  in
   16  accordance with regulations to be established by the commissioner.
   17    (B)  FOR  THE  PURPOSES OF THIS SUBDIVISION, THE TERM "DISPLAY DEVICE"
   18  SHALL MEAN EQUIPMENT DESIGNED AND USED FOR THE PURPOSE OF RECEIVING  AND
   19  DISPLAYING  BROADCAST  TELEVISION  IMAGES,  VISUAL IMAGES FROM A DIGITAL
   20  VIDEO DISC RECORDER OR PLAYER OR VIDEO CASSETTE RECORDER OR  PLAYER,  OR
   21  VISUAL  IMAGES  WHILE  TRANSMITTED  BY WIRELESS DIGITAL TECHNOLOGY. SUCH
   22  TERM SHALL NOT INCLUDE:
   23    (I) VEHICLE INFORMATION OR INSTRUMENTATION DISPLAYS;

    1    (II) A GLOBAL POSITIONING, NAVIGATIONAL OR MAPPING DISPLAY;
    2    (III)  A  VISUAL DISPLAY PRODUCED BY TECHNOLOGY, WHICH IS NOT A CLOSED
    3  CIRCUIT VIDEO CAMERA AND MONITOR, THAT ENHANCES OR SUPPLEMENTS THE DRIV-
    4  ER'S VIEW OF THE EXTERIOR TO THE FRONT OR SIDES OF A MOTOR  VEHICLE  FOR
    5  THE  PURPOSE  OF  MANEUVERING  THE  VEHICLE  AND  AVOIDING  CONTACT WITH
    6  PERSONS, ANIMALS OR OBJECTS; AND
    7    (IV) A CLOSED CIRCUIT VIDEO CAMERA AND MONITOR OR OTHER VISUAL DISPLAY
    8  THAT ENHANCES OR SUPPLEMENTS THE DRIVER'S VIEW OF THE  EXTERIOR  TO  THE
    9  REAR  OF  A MOTOR VEHICLE FOR THE PURPOSE OF MANEUVERING THE VEHICLE AND
   10  AVOIDING CONTACT WITH PERSONS, ANIMALS OR OBJECTS,  PROVIDED  THAT  SUCH
   11  MONITOR  OR  VISUAL  DISPLAY  IS  DEACTIVATED WHEN SUCH MOTOR VEHICLE IS
   12  SHIFTED OUT OF PARK OR REVERSE GEAR.
   13    S 2. This act shall take effect on the one hundred twentieth day after
   14  it shall have become a law; provided, however, that effective immediate-
   15  ly, the addition, amendment and/or repeal  of  any  rule  or  regulation
   16  necessary  for  the  implementation of this act on its effective date is
   17  authorized and directed to be made  and  completed  on  or  before  such
   18  effective date.
